div.span: Dr. Grimsley has released a Superintendent COVID-19 Bulletin that provides key information and resources for you as we move forward and continue to serve our RCPS family throughout this time.

p.span:
Dear RCPS Family,
As ordered by Governor Northam this afternoon, RCPS will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. However, we will continue to support our students and families during this time. RCPS will continue to offer free school meals for students. Also, we will continue with instruction the best we can throughout the remainder of the school year.

div.span: RCPS Nutrition Department has bagged lunches available for students while school is closed. All children under 18 qualify for a free meal. Meals can be picked up at the School Board Office or delivered to homes. Children must be present at the time of pick-up/delivery. To set up lunch pick-up/delivery, please call or text our Meal Access Hotline at 540-671-0153.
The Rappahannock Food Pantry is also available to any Rappahannock County resident. They have drive-thru hours on Tues/Thurs from 12 - 4pm and Saturdays 10am - 2pm.
We are an equal opportunity provider.

p.span: RCPS Family- Starting on Monday, March 30th, both RCES and RCHS will have new, set hours to answer phone calls. Visits are by appointment only to ensure that we can continue to practice social distancing by safely limiting the number of people in the buildings.
Thanks to the support of our community businesses, churches, and organizations, we have multiple locations where students and families can access high-speed internet!
CLICK HERE to view Hotspot Hub Locations

For a PDF version of the Hotspot Hub MAP, CLICK HERE. To view an INTERACTIVE MAP of the Hotspot Hub locations, visit https://www.arcgis.com/home/webmap/viewer.html?webmap=5194f63288714b7aa04fc3e3557b3b3e
During the May School Board Meeting, Dr. Grimsley proposed a new regulation to broaden non-resident tuition waiver eligibility requirements.

span.span: If you own land in Rappahannock or work anywhere within the county,
you may be eligible for a non-resident tuition waiver.

span.strong: Click here for the 2019 Non-Resident Tuition Application
Click here to view the regulation

span.span: CLICK HERE to view the SCHOOL BUS ROUTES for 2019-2020

PreK Class Applicants for 2020-21: Please send completed applications to the School Board Office as soon as possible after January 2 to ensure you are in the pool for the upcoming school year. A limited number of slots are available.
To empower every student to reach his or her full potential
Through educational opportunities, the mission for RCPS will be to promote a culture of learning, a roadmap for excellence,
and the passion and character that leads to each student's success.

span.a: Apply Now Free and Reduced Lunch
